title: Transitioning into mid game as Darius
body:
Easily my favorite champion and currently my only level 7 mastery, but even then there's a particular trend I've noticed on Darius that seems to be confirmed on Champion.gg : That he's stellar early game and fairly good late game if you build tank, but has trouble during the mid game particularly  at the point where you've won your lane (because you're Darius), but don't have your Dead Man's Plate and Spirit Visage completed making it difficult to tank. I mean, I GUESS you could just sit at the mid or back line and just wait for an opportunity to dunk someone who's low health and try to set up a dunk chain, but that seems to be difficult particularly because I don't have Dead Man's yet and am very easy to kite (It's become even harder to do this recently for some reason whether it's because of medication or tilt since my reactions have been slowed to the point where I miss most of my pulls in team fights and either dunk too early or too late and don't get my Noxian Might). 

So my question is this: Should I still be grouping up for teamfights after I've won my lane and just git gud with my reflexes, continue pushing my lane and hope that this causes the enemy team to have to send one or two people to deal with me that I should be able to deal with by myself if one of them is squishy until I have my core built (Possibly farming the enemy jungle as well), or something else entirely?

replies.body: Peel for your ADC.

I could, but Darius isn't exactly the best peel in the world. He seems to be a peel in the same sense that a poisonous caterpillar wards off birds by getting itself eaten and making the bird sick so that it knows not to eat more caterpillars.

(In this analogy the ADC is the caterpillar, the assassin is the bird, and you are the poison)

He's a very solid peeler actually.

Alistar can knock an assassin off of his carry, sure.

Darius will kill them. E whoever is diving, hit them with the Q>AA>W>AA>AA>R. Most assassins will die to this combo, giving you the potential for resets and making team fighting a very dangerous endeavor for the enemy team.

Darius in general isn't a diver. He wants to stack Noxian Might on the enemy front line and on people who dive.

Sure he CAN kill them, but only after the ADC you're suppose to be peeling for is dead. Also the problem is precisely that I can't stand at the front line to stack Hemorrhage because, without his core items, he's too squishy.

Mid Game darius is kind of funky. Your ult becomes relevant at level 2 so thats nice but youre at that stage where you have a cleaver, defensive boots, and maybe a defense item, but youre not at full tank potential. Your noxian might isnt badass since it reslly starts to ramp up during the last 5 levels to 18.

Play more like a tank if you can and use your strong peeling tools for your carries. Usually mages start popping off and adcs arent exactly at their prime at this point either.

Running ghost flash makes you lose map pressure can make your mid game teamfighting a lot more potent.
So... I SHOULD run Ghost/Flash?

I would probably recommend Teleport/Ghost. 

Not having a single teleport on your team can really screw you over both in lane (missed experience, enemy getting a free back to purchase) and late-game (inability to stop splitpushers or join teamfights).
Actually I probably could try that. I just feel that flash is too powerful not to use period.
I try to use both, but generally find myself wishing I'd taken the other.

Not built enough to be invincible, not early enough to crutch on badass stats; where champions find themselves in these paradigms I usually find they can provide some sort of off-tank or off-support to the group. Give 'em the ole' row'n'slow.

You're going to have to clarify by what you mean by playing as an off-tank because the problem I'm having is that I can't really stand at the front line because I can't really tank much of anything without DMP or Visage. Does an off-tank play differently than a normal tank or something?

Well I guess it'd probably depend if you got room to do any roaming or if teamfights were breaking out but you'd want to pick a squishy and play. Try to avoid the center of attention like a Leona would be aiming for, just force one person into an unfavorable fight-- bait an Ezreal out of his mobility, force a flash, that kind of thing. I've generally heard it's better to not die, so focus on what you can do rather than on trying to force what you can't.

I don't have experience though, I'm just roughing some ideas.

I have learned you need to get fed.
One thing I am still toying around with is getting chain vest/wardens mail then spirit visage and then your armor item. It works out ok but you are still a little squishy. Also level 7 Darius noxus roolz
Oh it works in lane at least, but I only ever do it if I'm facing Renekton or Jax/Tryndamere/Some other Duelist I'm struggling against respectively.

I don't know. I have generally found myself rushing my core item mr boots, then spirit or an armor item based on who is the most fed and counters me the hardest.

1. hitting lvl 2 and all in-ing. Dodge one of his q's with your's and you win
2. Poking him to about 80% hp and all in-ing dodge 1 of his q's with yours and you win.
3. Rush a vamp scepter and pretend Darius is Shen

I could, but Darius isn't exactly the best peel in the world.

By the end of laning phase you should have a completed {{item:3071}} and {{item:3742}} with {{item:3111}} in *almost* every case, even against most AP users you'll still want that deadmans rush because it's movement speed is just so valuable for Darius and you still have a tiny bit of MR from {{item:3111}} .

This will provide with really great roam potential and sticking power (while still having loads of hp to make up for the lack of resistances), and you basically just need to have a map presence once laning phase is over. Frontlineing isn't always effective, sometimes it's alright to flank their team and catch people out. As you stated, Darius is not a very suitable front-liner during the mid game so having all this movement speed for roams and catching out bot lane when they're overextended is essential for you to have an impact while you still aren't a complete tank yet.

I usually win or lose my lane right around the time my Cleaver and Mercs are completed. I'm also well aware that I need Dead Man's and Visage regardless of matchup to help prevent kiting, boost healing, and get the armor/HP/MR necessary to tank anything at all. My problem is when I've won my lane but DON'T have DMP yet because I just finished Cleaver and Mercs.
